trans-unit.source: Capture an image of a virtual machine running Windows Server
trans-unit.target: Capture an image of a virtual machine running Windows Server

trans-unit.source: Learn how to capture an image of an Azure virtual machine (VM) running Windows Server.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to capture an image of an Azure virtual machine (VM) running Windows Server.

trans-unit.source: How to capture a Windows virtual machine to use as an image
trans-unit.target: How to capture a Windows virtual machine to use as an image

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to capture an Azure virtual machine running Windows so you can use it as an image to create other virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to capture an Azure virtual machine running Windows so you can use it as an image to create other virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: This image includes the operating system disk and any data disks that are attached to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This image includes the operating system disk and any data disks that are attached to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't include networking configurations, so you'll need to configure those when you create the other virtual machines that use the template.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't include networking configurations, so you'll need to configure those when you create the other virtual machines that use the template.

trans-unit.source: Azure stores the image under My Images.
trans-unit.target: Azure stores the image under My Images.

trans-unit.source: This is the same place where any images you've uploaded are stored.
trans-unit.target: This is the same place where any images you've uploaded are stored.

trans-unit.source: For details about images, see <link><linkText>About virtual machine images in Azure[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details about images, see <link><linkText>About virtual machine images in Azure[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Before you begin
trans-unit.target: Before you begin

trans-unit.source: These steps assume that you've already created an Azure virtual machine and configured the operating system, including attaching any data disks.
trans-unit.target: These steps assume that you've already created an Azure virtual machine and configured the operating system, including attaching any data disks.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't done this yet, see these instructions:
trans-unit.target: If you haven't done this yet, see these instructions:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create a custom virtual machine running Windows[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create a custom virtual machine running Windows[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How to attach a data disk to a virtual machine[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How to attach a data disk to a virtual machine[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: This process deletes the original virtual machine after it's captured, and is not intended as a way to back up a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: This process deletes the original virtual machine after it's captured, and is not intended as a way to back up a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: One possible way to do that is Azure Backup, which is available as a preview in certain regions.
trans-unit.target: One possible way to do that is Azure Backup, which is available as a preview in certain regions.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Back up Azure virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Back up Azure virtual machines</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Other solutions are available from certified partners.
trans-unit.target: Other solutions are available from certified partners.

trans-unit.source: To find out what’s currently available, search the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: To find out what’s currently available, search the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Capture the virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Capture the virtual machine

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, Connect to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, Connect to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>How to sign in to a virtual machine running Windows Server[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>How to sign in to a virtual machine running Windows Server[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Open a Command Prompt window as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open a Command Prompt window as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Change the directory to %windir%\system32\sysprep, and then run sysprep.exe.
trans-unit.target: Change the directory to %windir%\system32\sysprep, and then run sysprep.exe.

trans-unit.source: The System Preparation Tool dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The System Preparation Tool dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: In System Cleanup Action, select Enter System Out-of-Box Experience (OOBE) and make sure that Generalize is checked.
trans-unit.target: In System Cleanup Action, select Enter System Out-of-Box Experience (OOBE) and make sure that Generalize is checked.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using Sysprep, see <link><linkText>How to Use Sysprep: An Introduction[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using Sysprep, see <link><linkText>How to Use Sysprep: An Introduction[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In Shutdown Options, select Shutdown.
trans-unit.target: In Shutdown Options, select Shutdown.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Run Sysprep</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Run Sysprep</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Sysprep shuts down the virtual machine, which changes the status of the virtual machine in the Azure portal to Stopped.
trans-unit.target: Sysprep shuts down the virtual machine, which changes the status of the virtual machine in the Azure portal to Stopped.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, click Virtual Machines and select the virtual machine you want to capture.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, click Virtual Machines and select the virtual machine you want to capture.

trans-unit.source: On the command bar, click Capture.
trans-unit.target: On the command bar, click Capture.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Capture virtual machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Capture virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Capture the Virtual Machine dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The Capture the Virtual Machine dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: In Image Name, type a name for the new image.
trans-unit.target: In Image Name, type a name for the new image.

trans-unit.source: Before you add a Windows Server image to your set of custom images, it must be generalized by running Sysprep as instructed in the previous steps.
trans-unit.target: Before you add a Windows Server image to your set of custom images, it must be generalized by running Sysprep as instructed in the previous steps.

trans-unit.source: Click I have run Sysprep on the virtual machine to indicate you did that.
trans-unit.target: Click I have run Sysprep on the virtual machine to indicate you did that.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to capture the image.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to capture the image.

trans-unit.source: The new image is now available under Images.
trans-unit.target: The new image is now available under Images.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image capture successful</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image capture successful</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: The image is ready to be used to create virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The image is ready to be used to create virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you'll create a virtual machine by using the From Gallery menu item and selecting the image you just created.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you'll create a virtual machine by using the From Gallery menu item and selecting the image you just created.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Create a custom virtual machine running Windows[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <link><linkText>Create a custom virtual machine running Windows[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
